result.description: This transform is meant to serve as a utility for the Search Composite Data Broker, "Search EVAM Data Resource". It's job is to pick between an optionally provided EVAM Definition ID passed in to the Data Broker call, and an EVAM Definition ID configured on the Search Application ID passed in to the Data Broker. If one is specified on the Data Broker call via the "searchEvamConfigId" input prop, that will be used. Else, if there is an EVAM Definition specified on the Search Application record passed, that value is selected and returned.

result.description:
Maps the data items retrieved from related records filter to data set component values. View Template resolver block of Related Records now-data-set EVAM component. Performs following key activities -
a) Retreives the list of records corresponding to the filter
b) Gets the valid templates based on the selected Table
c) retrieves the actual view component prop-field map, prop-action map corresponding to each data-item that it gets as input from EVAM Data Fetcher
d) runs over each data-item to
 - resolve values for view component props using prop-field lookup
 - translate or sanitize static values for view component prop
 - resolve view component action from prop-action lookup
e) returns list of component with resolved propValues to render each data-item

result.description:
To check for if there are any best practices which were changed for a given release. The best practices are changed based on the following condition :

Say we have a relesase as "Release SomeVersion", then for this ( current ) release version , the condition to check for updated / changed / removed best practices will be :
<  "first_introduced"== "Release SomeVersion" OR changed == "Release SomeVersion" OR "removed" == "Release SomeVersion" >

This should give us total count of all BPs changed for the current release that is - "ReleaseNow"

result.description:
View Template resolver block of EVAM. Performs following key activities -
a) retrieves the actual view component prop-field map, prop-action map corresponding to each data-item that it gets as input from EVAM Data Fetcher
b) runs over each data-item to
 - resolve values for view component props using prop-field lookup
 - translate or sanitize static values for view component prop
 - resolve view component action from prop-action lookup
c) returns list of component with resolved propValues to render each data-item

result.description:
Fetches Declarative Actions relevant to Playbooks, Playbook Stages, or Playbook Cards.  

For Playbook actions, pass "16f2aef6c32110109b1204186e40dd7f" to the DA Model (source) field.
For Stage actions, pass "61cd5e20c30210109b1204186e40ddb0" to the DA Model (source) field.
For Card actions, pass "ca57d12e730333004a905ee515f6a7b2" to the DA Model (source) field.

result.description:
Returns Data visualization API results for the indicator data source. Supports a single data source.
For simple visualizations (eg. Single Score), do not set Group by field, and Trend by field should be set to disable.
For group visualizations (eg. Bar), set the Group by field(Only one group is supported.) and Trend by field should be set to disable.
For time series visualizations, set the Trend by to enable, also can set Group by field (Only one group is supported.)
The properties take the sys_id's of Performance Analytics objects as parameters. You can use the Copy Sys ID context action, or the PAScorecards API to get these sys_id values. See "Performance Analytics API Examples" in the product documentation.

To set up you will need a table name and conditions to filter suitable records from that table. After adding the record watcher, an Asynchronous Message Bus (AMB) channel will be created and subscribed by the data resource to watch for record status updates. You can add events to handle status updates from the record watcher.
